title: Neurotrophic Keratitis: Prevalence and Epidemiology
short_description: A clinical document describing the rare prevalence of neurotrophic keratitis, affecting fewer than 5 per 10,000 people in the general population.
long_description: This clinical research document provides epidemiological information about neurotrophic keratitis, a rare ocular disorder. The document establishes the prevalence rate of this condition at below 5 cases per 10,000 individuals in the general population and includes a clear definition of prevalence as an epidemiological measure. The content appears to be part of a larger clinical or educational resource aimed at understanding the frequency and distribution of this uncommon corneal condition in healthcare populations.
